parameters.name: input
parameters.description: An XML object, which needs to be transformed

parameters.name: xsl
parameters.description: The XSL style sheet represented in an XML object

returnParameters.description:
The transformed result represented in an XML object or else an `error` if the given `XML` object
cannot be transformed

functions.name: transform
functions.description:
Transforms the single-rooted XML content to another XML/HTML/plain text using XSL transformations.
```ballerina
xml|error target = xslt:transform(sourceXml, xsl);
```

errors.name: TransformError
errors.description: Represents a `TransformError` with the message and the cause.

modules.summary: This module provides an API to transform the XML content to another XML/HTML/plain text using XSL transformations.
modules.description:
## Overview

This module provides an API to transform the XML content to another XML/HTML/plain text using XSL transformations.

The Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations (XSLT) is used to obtain alternative XML representations and especially for generating HTML documents.

Usage of the XSLT API is as follows:
```ballerina
xml target = check xslt:transform(sourceXml, xsl);
```
This module provides an API to transform the XML content to another XML/HTML/plain text using XSL transformations.

functions.description: Transforms the single-rooted XML content to another XML/HTML/plain text using XSL transformations.

errors.description: Represents a `TransformError` with the message and the cause.
